text:
Pastry:
3 c. flourÂ Â â¢Â  2 egg yolksÂ Â â¢Â  1-1/4 c. waterÂ Â â¢Â  1 tbsp. vinegarÂ Â â¢Â  1 c. flourÂ Â â¢Â  1 pound Blue Bonnet margarine

In a bowl mix 3 c. flour and 2 yolks. In a glass or small bowl mix water and vinegar and add to yolk mixture. Mix well with a wooden spoon until it forms a ball. Set aside.

Mix 1 c. flour with Blue Bonnet margarine. Work the margarine into the flour well and roll out on waxed paper. Set aside. Roll the first dough out on a pastry board as big as possible. Roll the Blue Bonnet and flour dough out to the same size and place on top of the other dough. Fold dough as listed in BUTTERSTRUDEL. Fold it three times and between foldings let dough rest for 1/2 hour. After it has been rolled out the third time, fold it up and place in the refrigerator for a few hours. Then cut it into quarters.

Roll out one quarter of the dough and cut into about 20 squares. Place a little filling on each square and fold one corner on the opposite corner. Place on ungreased cooky sheet and bake at 350Â° for about 30 minutes, or until done.

Paula Deen's Sand Tarts Recipe

Active time: 45 minutes
Bake time: 45 minutes per batch
Total time: 1 hour 30 minutes plus cooling
Makes: 3 dozen cookies 


1 c. butter (2 sticks), softened
1 tsp. vanilla extract
1 c. confectionersâ sugar
1 Â¾ c. all-purpose flour
1 c. pecans, finely chopped

Directions

1 - Preheat oven to 275Â°F.

2 - In large bowl, with mixer on medium speed, beat butter, vanilla, and Â½ cup sugar until smooth, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula. Reduce speed to low; gradually beat in flour just until blended, occasionally scraping bowl.

3 - With floured hands, shape dough by level measuring tablespoons into about 2" by Â½" crescents. Place crescents, 2 inches apart, on 2 ungreased large cookie sheets.

4 - Place cookie sheets on 2 oven racks. Bake about 45 minutes or until edges are lightly browned, rotating cookie sheets between upper and lower racks halfway through cooking. With metal spatula, transfer cookies to wire racks set over waxed paper. Immediately sprinkle remaining confectioners' sugar over through sleve over cookies to coat well. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.

5 - Store cookies in tightly sealed container, with waxed paper between layers, at room temperature, up to 2 weeks or in freezer up to 3 months.

6 - Nutrition facts (each cookie): About 105 calories, 1 g protein, 8 g carbohydrate, 8 g total fat (4 g saturated), 1 g fiber, 15 mg cholesterol, 55 mg sodium.

Here is the recipe from my friend:

1 - Get pears (dâanjou or red or bosc â Bartlett are a bit too runny); peel them, cut in half, scoop out seeds.

2 - Melt some butter in a baking dish, add some brown sugar. (Iâd say 1 or 2 TB of each per pear? I never measure these things: you donât need them swimming, you just want enough to make sauce.)

3 - Place pear halves in, and pour over them some honey and good balsamic vinegar (good, rich vinegar is what makes this work. Not too much, but donât be afraid of it.)

4 - Cover with foil, bake at 350 for about 25ish minutes, then bake uncovered for a few minutes to let the sauce reduce a bit.

5 - I like to let them cool a bit before serving (I try to take them out of the oven as we sit down to dinner), so the cheese doesnât melt.

6 - Serve with fresh chevre. You know this part.

Ingredients: 

2 large whole-wheat pitasÂ Â â¢Â  Cooking sprayÂ Â â¢Â  1/2 cup assorted fresh vegetables (broccoli/cauliflower florets, red/green pepper strips, sliced mushrooms, chopped carrot, onions... your choice)Â Â â¢Â  1/4 cup pizza sauceÂ Â â¢Â  1/4 cup part-skim mozzarella

Preparation:

1 - Preheat oven to 400Â°f. Place pita bread halves on a baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes.

2 - Meanwhile, coat an unheated small skillet with nonstick cooking spray. Preheat over medium heat. Add the vegetables; cook and stir until crisp-tender.

3 - Spread pizza sauce on pita bread rounds; sprinkle with cooked vegetables and cheese. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes more or until light brown. Serve warm.

To make cake, beat butter, half the sugar, egg yolks, lemon rind + salt into a large bowl until pale and fluffy. Beat egg whites until stiff, and fold in the remaining sugar. text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Soups and Sandwiches - Chicken and Dumplings.md
text:
Prep: 50 min. Â Â â¢Â   Chill: 2 hr. Â Â â¢Â  Cook: 66 min.

1 eggÂ Â â¢Â  3 Tbsp.cold waterÂ Â â¢Â  2 Tbsp.peanut oilÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ tsp.kosher saltÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup all-purpose flourÂ Â â¢Â  4 - to 4Â½ - lb. broiler-fryer chicken, quarteredÂ Â â¢Â  1 tsp.kosher saltÂ Â â¢Â  5 cups chicken stock or brothÂ Â â¢Â  2 cups waterÂ Â â¢Â  2 stalks celery halved crosswiseÂ Â â¢Â  1 medium onion, peeled and sliced in halfÂ Â â¢Â  3 hard-cooked eggs, slicedÂ Â â¢Â  2 Tbsp.cold butter, cut in Â¼-inch cubesÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup whipping creamÂ Â â¢Â  Ground black pepper

1 - For dumplings: In medium bowl whisk together egg, cold water, oil, and the Â½ teaspoon salt. Stir in flour. Mix until well-blended and elastic. Cover. Refrigerate 2 hours.

2 - Season chicken, including back and neck, with the 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside. In 6-quart Dutch oven combine chicken stock, water, celery, onion, and pinch of kosher salt. Bring to a boil. Add chicken pieces, placing leg quarters and backbone first. Place breast, skin side down, on top. Reduce heat to just below simmer. Cover, Leaving half-inch opening.

3 - Cook 30 to 45 minutes or until breasts are just done; remove. Continue cooking leg quarters 30 to 40 minutes until tender; remove chicken and vegetables. Set broth in pot aside. Discard vegetables. Set chicken aside. Cool. Remove skin. Pull meat from bones, tearing into large pieces. Set aside. Discard bones.

4 - For dumplings: Turn dough onto well-floured surface. Roll very thin, about 1/16 inch; cut in 1Â½- by 2Â½-inch pieces. Return broth to boiling. Season well with additional kosher salt. Add dumplings to broth, shaking pot occasionally. Do not stir. Cook 3 to 5 minutes. Add reserved chicken and egg. Reduce to simmer. Add butter, cream, and few grindings of black pepper. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat; cover. Let stand 10 minutes. SERVES 8.

text:

Folks who love chocolate chip cookies will enjoy that same great flavor in these golden bars. They can be mixed up in a jiffy, taste wonderful, and are perfect for occasions when company drops by unexpectedly or you need a treat in a hurry.
âRhonda Knight, Hecker, Illinois

36 Servings
Prep: 10 min. Â Â â¢Â  Bake: 20 min. + cooling

Ingredients

1-Â½ cups packed brown sugarÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ cup butter, meltedÂ Â â¢Â  2 eggs, lightly beatenÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon vanilla extractÂ Â â¢Â  1-Â½ cups all-purpose flourÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ teaspoon baking powderÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ teaspoon saltÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup (6 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips

Directions

In a large bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla just until blended. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt; add to brown sugar mixture. Stir in chocolate chips.
Spread into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan. Bake at 350Â° for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

Nutrition Facts

1 serving (1 each) equals 102 calories, 4 g fat (2 g saturated fat), 19 mg cholesterol, 72 mg sodium, 16 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 1 g protein.

Oil or spray a popover pan (with nonstick vegetable oil spray). Preheat the oven to 400Â° and set the rack in the middle of the oven. Preheat popover pan in the oven for about 2 minutes. text:

SPONGE:
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon all-purpose flourÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon baking powderÂ Â â¢Â  Â¾ cup pitted datesÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cups boiling waterÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon baking sodaÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup unsalted butter, softenedÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup granulated sugarÂ Â â¢Â  1 large egg, lightly beatenÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon vanilla

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 10-inch round or square baking dish. Sift the flour and baking powder onto a sheet of

electric mixer beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla; beat until blended. Gradually beat in 

the flour mixture. Add the date mixture to the batter and fold until blended with a rubber spatula. Pour into the prepared 

baking dish. Bake until pudding is set and firm on top, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven to a wire rack.

Toffee sauce: Combine butter, heavy cream and brown sugar in a small heavy saucepan. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly.

immediately spooned into dessert bowls. Drizzle with toffee sauce and top with a spoonful of whipped cream.

text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Sauces - Classic Swiss Three Cheese Fondue.md
text:
Classic Swiss Three-Cheese Fondue

1 garlic clove, peeled
1 c dry white wine
1 Tbsp fresh lemon juice
8 oz Gruyere cheese, rind trimmed and discarded, and shredded (about 2 1/2 c)
8 oz Emmentaler cheese, rind trimmed and discarded, and shredded (about 2 1/2 c)
3 oz Appenzeller cheese, cut into small cubes (about 1/2 c)
4 tsp cornstarch
1 Tbsp Kirsh (Kirshwasser)
A few gratings of nutmeg (OPTIONAL)
Freshly ground pepper, to taste

1. Rub the inside of a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan with the garlic; discard the garlic. Add the wine and lemon juice and bring to a bare simmer over medium heat.

2. In a medium bowl, toss the Gruyere, Emmentaler, and Appenzeller cheeses with the cornstarch. A handful at a time, stir the cheese mixture into the wine, stirring the first batch until it is almost completely melted before adding another. The fondue can bubble gently, but do not boil. Stir in the kirsh and season with nutmeg and pepper.

text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Meat - Roast Loin of Pork with Fennel.md
text:
Cook Time: 1 hr 20 minÂ Â â¢Â  Level: IntermediateÂ Â â¢Â  Yield: 8 servings

Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, mincedÂ Â â¢Â  Salt and freshly ground black pepper, plus 1 tablespoon kosher saltÂ Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon fresh thyme leavesÂ Â â¢Â  1/4 cup Dijon mustardÂ Â â¢Â  1 (3-pound) boneless pork loin, trimmed and tiedÂ Â â¢Â  3 small fennel bulbs, tops removedÂ Â â¢Â  6 carrots, peeled, and thickly sliced diagonallyÂ Â â¢Â  10 small potatoes (red or white-skinned), cut in quartersÂ Â â¢Â  2 yellow onions, thickly slicedÂ Â â¢Â  4 tablespoons good olive oilÂ Â â¢Â  4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted


Directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.

With a mortar and pestle, or in a food processor fitted with a steel blade, grind together the garlic, 1 tablespoon salt, and thyme leaves. Add the mustard. Spread the mixture over the loin of pork and allow it to sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, cut the fennel bulbs into thick wedges, cutting through the core. Toss the fennel, carrots, potatoes, and onions in a bowl with the olive oil, melted butter, salt, and pepper to taste. Place the vegetables in a large roasting pan and cook for 30 minutes.

Add the pork loin to the pan and continue to cook for another 30 to 50 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the middle of the pork reads exactly 138 degrees. Remove the meat from the pan and return the vegetables to the oven to keep cooking. Cover the meat with aluminum foil and allow it to rest for 15 minutes. Remove the strings from the meat and slice it thickly. Arrange the meat and vegetables on a platter. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Serve warm.

This soup is like a Gazpacho; you can add any number of different garnishes to the finished soup when serving.

2 pounds cucumbers (about 4 medium), peeled and seededÂ Â â¢Â  2 cloves garlicÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ small onionÂ Â â¢Â  3 cups chicken brothÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup sour creamÂ Â â¢Â  3 tablespoons white wine vinegarÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon salt, or to tasteÂ Â â¢Â  Dash of Tabasco or cayenne pepper

Garnishes:
1 tomato, choppedÂ Â â¢Â  1 small bunch scallions, trimmed and sliced thinÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup chopped parsleyÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup toasted sliced almonds

Using a food processor and working in two or three batches, process the cucumbers, garlic, onion, and 1 cup of the chicken broth, until you have a purÃ©e. Pour all of the cucumber mixture into a large mixing bowl and add the remaining broth, sour cream, vinegar, salt, and Tabasco or cayenne and whisk together until thoroughly blended and smooth. Taste and correct seasonings. Chill in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours. Stir well before serving. Pass the garnishes of tomato, scallion, parsley, and almonds in separate bowls or spoon some of each into the soup bowl before serving.

1Â½ cups turkey brineÂ Â â¢Â  4 qt. buttermilkÂ Â â¢Â  1 fresh turkey, 16-18 lbs., heart, neck and gizzard removed (reserved, if desired)Â Â â¢Â  4 Tbs. (Â½ stick) butter, at room temperature

In saucepan, bring turkey brine and 1 qt. water to boil. Simmer over medium-low heat, stirring until brine dissolves, 5-10 minutes.
Let cool to room temperature. In large pot, combine brine mixture and buttermilk.

Rinse turkey with cold water; place in large brining bag. Carefully pour in brine; seal bag.
Place in large pot; refrigerate 24-36 hours.

Remove turkey from brine. Rinse turkey with cold water; pat dry. Trim off excess fat. Place turkey, breast side up, on rack in large roasting pan. Rub skin with butter. Truss as desired.
Let stand at room temperature 1 hour.

Position rack in lower third of oven; preheat to 400Â°F. Roast turkey 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 325Â°F; continue roasting, basting every 30 minutes with pan juices. If breast cooks too quickly, tent with foil. After 2 hours total roasting time, begin testing for doneness with instant-read thermometer; breast should register 165Â°F and thigh, 175Â°F. Total roasting time should be 3-4 hours.

Transfer turkey to carving board; tent with foil. Let rest 20-30 minutes before carving.
Serves 12-14.

Servings: 6

It is best to make the sauce well ahead of time, since it takes quite a while to cool completely.

text:
Prep time: 5 min. total time: 55 min.Â Â â¢Â  Serves 4

(if you use wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least twenty minutes before grilling.)

Â½ cup red wine vinegarÂ Â â¢Â  1 garlic clove, mincedÂ Â â¢Â  1Â½ teaspoons coarse saltÂ Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon honeyÂ Â â¢Â  2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oilÂ Â â¢Â  Freshly ground pepperÂ Â â¢Â  8 boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 3 pieces eachÂ Â â¢Â  1 large red onion, cut into 8 wedges, root left intact

(1) preheat oven to 375Â°. stir together vinegar, garlic, salt, honey, and oil in a large bowl; season with pepper. add chicken and onion to the marinade. let stand at room temperature, tossing occasionally, 15 minutes.

(2) thread 6 pieces of chicken and 1 onion wedge onto each of 4 skewers. transfer skewers and remaining onion wedges to a non-reactive baking dish; drizzle marinade on top. bake until chicken is cooked through, 35 to 40 minutes. divide skewers and onion wedges among serving plates; drizzle with juices from baking dish.

text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Vegetables - German Potato Salad - Claudia Twarski.md
text:
Claudia Twarski
German Potato Salad

5# Potatoes
1# Bacon
1 large onion diced
1/4 cup flour
1/3 cup lemon juice less 1 1/2 tbls
1/3 cup vinegar plus 1 1/2 tbls.
1/3 cup dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1 1/3 cup hot water from tap

Cook potatoes in skins until tender (be careful not to overcook, if you overcook, be sure potatoes are cold before you cut them). Cool in ice cold water. Peel and cut in small pieces. Put in a large bowl.

Cut bacon into small pieces and brown over medium heat until bacon is crisp. Remove bacon from pan with slotted spoon and sprinkle crisp bacon bits over cut up potatoes.

Cook diced onion in bacon grease until translucent using a low heat. When onions translucent, remove from bacon grease with slotted spoon and sprinkle onion pieces over cut-up potatoes. Lightly pepper potatoes with freshly ground pepper and lightly toss potatoes with bacon and onion to mix. Do not over mix as potatoes may break up too much or become mushy.

Remove all but 1/4 cup of grease from pan to save for sauerkraut or toss out. Increase heat under bacon grease and add flour to grease and mix well with slotted spoon until blended. Slowly and carefully (so you wonât get splashed with grease) add vinegar and lemon juice to grease and blend with slotted spoon. Add sugars to gravy mixture, and blend with slotted spoon. Carefully add hot water to mixture and quickly blend with slotted spoon.

Pour gravy mixture over potatoes and gingerly mix (not to mush potatoes) and serve warm.

Prep Time: 20 minÂ Â â¢Â  Cook Time: 1 hr 2 minÂ Â â¢Â  Level: EasyÂ Â â¢Â  Serves: 6 to 8 servings

Ingredients:
1 pound ground veal (preferably naturally raised)Â Â â¢Â  1 pound pork (preferably naturally raised Berkshire)Â Â â¢Â  1 pound ground beef (preferably naturally raised)Â Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon chopped, fresh chives, plus 1 teaspoon for the sauceÂ Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon chopped, fresh thyme leaves, plus 1 teaspoon for the sauceÂ Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon chopped fresh Italian parsley, plus 1 teaspoon for the sauceÂ Â â¢Â  3 large eggs (preferably organic)Â Â â¢Â  1 1/3 cups finely ground PankoÂ Â â¢Â  2/3 cup whole milk (preferably hormone and antibiotic free)Â Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon kosher saltÂ Â â¢Â  1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper
Olive oilÂ Â â¢Â  2 stalks of celery, finely dicedÂ Â â¢Â  1 large Spanish onion, finely dicedÂ Â â¢Â  2 cups chicken or beef stockÂ Â â¢Â  8 to 10 cloves roasted garlicÂ Â â¢Â  3 tablespoons butter, at room temperature


Directions
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

Place the veal, pork, beef, chives, thyme, parsley, eggs, Panko, milk, salt, and pepper in a large mixing bowl.

Heat a medium sautÃ© pan over medium-high heat and melt it with extra-virgin olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the celery and onion to the pan and cook, stirring, until softened. Remove the celery and onion from the pan and let cool. When the mixture is cool, add it to the mixing bowl with the other ingredients.

Using clean hands, mix the ingredients until well combined and everything is evenly distributed. Place a piece of parchment paper on a sheet pan (it should have sides at least 1 1/2 inches high to prevent grease runoff from the pan). Place the meat on the sheet pan and pat it and punch it down to remove any air pockets. Shape the meat into a loaf (about 14 1/2 inches long by 5 inches wide by 2 inches high). Place the sheet pan in the oven and bake 40 to 50 minutes or until a meat thermometer indicates an internal temperature of 155 to 160 degrees. Remove the meatloaf from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, for the sauce, combine the broth, roasted garlic and butter over medium-high heat and simmer for about 10 to 15 minutes, or until lightly thickened. Add the rest of the chopped thyme, chives and parsley. Slice the meatloaf into serving portions and spoon the hot sauce over the meatloaf and serve.

text:
2 tablespoons - unsalted butterÂ Â â¢Â  1 large onion - finely choppedÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ cup - dry white wineÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ cup - beef stock (preferably homemade or reduced sodium)Â Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon - white wine vinegarÂ Â â¢Â  1 pound - Gruyere cheese (rind trimmed and discarded, shredded; about 6 cups)Â Â â¢Â  2 tablespoons - all-purpose flourÂ Â â¢Â  1 tablespoon - Cognac or brandyÂ Â â¢Â  1 Â½ teaspoons - finely chopped fresh thyme or Â½ teaspoon dried thymeÂ Â â¢Â  Freshly ground pepper - to taste


1. In a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring often, until the onion is dark golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add the wine, stock, and vinegar, and bring to a simmer.

2. In a medium bowl, toss the cheese with the flour. A handful at a time, stir the cheese into the saucepan, stirring each addition until melted before adding the next. Allow the fondue to bubble lightly a few times, but do not bring it to a boil. Stir in the Cognac and thyme. Season with pepper.

Makes 4â6 servings

6 - Drop teaspoons of sour cream around the edge of the cheesecake. Garnish with drained orange segments.

text:
Servings: 10


Â¼ cup - powdered sugar (to sprinkle on towel)Â Â â¢Â  Â¾ cup - all-purpose flourÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ teaspoon - baking powderÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ teaspoon - baking sodaÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ teaspoon - ground cinnamonÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ teaspoon - ground clovesÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ teaspoon - saltÂ Â â¢Â  3 - large eggsÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup - granulated sugarÂ Â â¢Â  â cup - libby'sÂ® 100% pure pumpkinÂ Â â¢Â  1 (8-ounce) package - cream cheese, softenedÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup - powdered sugar, siftedÂ Â â¢Â  6 tablespoons - butter or margarine, softenedÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon - vanilla extractÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ cup - powdered sugar (optional, for garnish)


1 - preheat oven to 375 degrees f. grease a 15 x 10-inch jelly-roll pan; line with wax paper. grease and flour paper. sprinkle towel with powdered sugar.

2 - combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt in a small bowl. beat eggs and sugar in a large mixer bowl until thick. beat in pumpkin. stir in flour mixture. spread evenly into a prepared pan. sprinkle with nuts.

3 - bake for 13 to 15 minutes or until top of cake springs back when touched. immediately loosen and turn cake onto a prepared towel. carefully peel off paper. roll up cake and towel together, starting with narrow end. cool on wire rack.

4 - beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, butter, and vanilla extract in a small mixer bowl until smooth. carefully unroll cake; remove towel. spread cream cheese mixture over cake. re-roll cake. wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least one hour. sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving, if desired.

text:
Total Time: 48 minÂ Â â¢Â  Prep: 15 minÂ Â â¢Â  Cook: 33 minÂ Â â¢Â  Yield: 10 servingsÂ Â â¢Â  Level: Easy

Ingredients: 1 (1.22-pound) package lean hot Italian turkey sausage, casings removedÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup chopped onionÂ Â â¢Â  2 cloves garlic, mincedÂ Â â¢Â  6 cups low-sodium chicken brothÂ Â â¢Â  4 cups chopped Swiss chard, stems removedÂ Â â¢Â  2 (15 1/2-ounce) cans great Northern beans, drained and rinsedÂ Â â¢Â  Salt and freshly cracked black pepperÂ Â â¢Â  Mini cornbread muffins, optional

Directions

Stir in the broth, Swiss chard, and beans. Add salt and pepper, to taste. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer until Swiss chard is tender, about 20 minutes. Serve w/ new potatoes & asparagus or beans & melon balls (cantaloupe & honey dew).

text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Desserts - Oeufs a╠Ç la Neige (Snow Eggs).md
text:
Makes 6 to 8 servings

3 cups milkÂ Â â¢Â  1 vanilla beanÂ Â â¢Â  6 large egg yolksÂ Â â¢Â  1 cup sugarÂ Â â¢Â  1 teaspoon brandy or kirschÂ Â â¢Â  Pinch of saltÂ Â â¢Â  3 large egg whites, at room temperatureÂ Â â¢Â  Caramel Syrup (optional; recipe follows)


1 - In nonaluminum, 2-quart saucepan, heat milk and vanilla bean over low heat 10 minutes. Do not heat to boiling. Remove vanilla bean; wash and dry to use again, if desired.

2 - In 4-cup measuring cup used for milk, or in small bowl, beat egg yolks, Â½ cup sugar, the brandy, and salt. Beat in a little warm milk. Beat yolk mixture back into milk in saucepan. Heat gently over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens slightly and coats a spoonâabout 15 minutes. Pour custard into large shallow serving dish and set aside to cool.

3 - Fill large skillet halfway with water and heat to simmering. In small bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add remaining Â½ cup sugar, beating until stiff peaks form. With large spoon, scoop up egg-white meringue and shape into a large oval or "egg" with the help of another spoon or spatula. Slide meringue "egg" into simmering water. Poach "eggs," 6 at a time, for 3 minutes. Gently turn "eggs" and poach 3 minutes longer. Remove with slotted spoon to drain on paper towels.

4 - Arrange "eggs" on top of cooled custard in serving dish. Refrigerate until serving time.

5 - Before serving, prepare Caramel Syrup. Drizzle over meringue "eggs."

Caramel Syrup: In small saucepan, combine Â½ cup sugar and 1 tablespoon water until well mixed. Cook over low heat until sugar is completely dissolved and amber in color. Do not stir the sugar as it melts but swirl the pan so it melts evenly. Cool a few minutes before using.

text:
1 8Â¾ oz. can pineapple tidbitsÂ Â â¢Â  1 11 oz. can mandarin orange sectionsÂ Â â¢Â  1 17 oz. can fruit cocktailÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ cup flaked coconutÂ Â â¢Â  2 Tbs lemon juiceÂ Â â¢Â  1 3Â¾ oz or 3â oz. pkg. instant lemon pudding mixÂ Â â¢Â  2 bananas

Frozen whipped dessert topping (thawed)

In large bowl, combine undrained pineapple tidbits, undrained orange sections, fruit cocktail with coconut and lemon juice. Sprinkle instant lemon pudding mix over fruits and toss lightly to combine; chill just before serving.

Peel and slice 1 Â½ c. bananas. Fold bananas into lemon-fruit mixture. Serve in dessert dishes or sherbet; top with thawed whipped dessert topping, if desired. Makes 10 servings.

Aunt Helen (Brownlee)
Biloxi, MS
April 1970

Preparation:

Sprinkle yeast on lukewarm water in mixing bowl; stir to dissolve. Add sugar, salt and stir to
dissolve; add flour and knead dough until smooth and elastic. Let rise at least Â½ hour.

While dough is rising, prepare a baking soda water bath with 2 cups of warm water and 2 tablespoons of baking soda. Be certain to stir often.

After the dough has risen, pinch off bits of dough and roll into a long rope (about Â½ of an inch or less thick) and shape. Dip pretzel in soda solution and place on a greased baking sheet. Allow pretzels to rise again. Bake in the oven at 450Â° for about 10 minutes or until golden. Brush with melted butter and enjoy!


Toppings:

After you brush with butter try sprinkling with coarse salt.

Or for Auntie Anne's famous cinnamon sugar, try melting a stick of butter in a shallow bowl (big enough to fit the entire pretzel) and in another shallow bowl make a mixture of cinnamon and sugar. Dip the pretzel into the butter, coating both sides generously. then dip again into the cinnamon mixture. Enjoy!

text_path: src/lib/data/markdown/markdown/Vegetables - Summer Potato Salad - Gerry Edwards.md
text:
Summer Potato Salad
Gerry Edwards

2 pounds small red potatoes
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
3 tablespoons walnut oil - VEG
3 tablespoons olive oil
4 oz. feta cheese, crumbled (1 cup) or LESS
1/2 lb. young green beans, ends snapped off
8 large basil leaves
2 red peppers, roasted
5 cups salad greens* - OPTIONAL

Steam potatoes for 15 to 20 minutes, depending on size, until tender. In a large bowl, mix salt, vinegar, walnut oil and the olive oil. Crumble cheese into dressing.

A few minutes before potatoes are ready, bring a large amount of water to a boil and drop in beans for 2 minutes, or long enough to cook away their raw crunch. Peel steaming potatoes hot and cut into 1/4-inch slices; toss them in dressing. Drain the beans and toss them with the potatoes. With your hands, shred the basil leaves and add to salad. Cut the roasted peppers into strips and add to salad. Taste and adjust seasoning.

When ready to serve, toss in salad greens.

Apple Strudel
Serves

Â½ c golden raisinsÂ Â â¢Â  5 Granny Smith apples (about 1 pound), peeled, cored, halved & thinly sliced.Â Â â¢Â  Â½ - 1 lemon juicedÂ Â â¢Â  1 T lemon zest, finely gratedÂ Â â¢Â  1 tsp ground cinnamonÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ c brown sugar, packedÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ c bread crumbs (plain)Â Â â¢Â  2 T butter, cut into piecesÂ Â â¢Â  8 sheets phyllo doughÂ Â â¢Â  2 T butter, melted for brushing phyllo sheetsÂ Â â¢Â  1 T granulated sugar

Preheat oven to 350Â° (Bake 350Â° for 30 min)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Combine raisins (soak if too dried for 15 min. prior to using), apples, lemon juice, lemon zest, cinnamon, brown sugar, bread crumbs, and butter in a large bowl.

Remove phyllo dough one sheet at a time & brush with butter, repeat w/ remaining sheets. Cover unused sheets with damp towel. Place apple mixture along one end leaving a 2" border. Roll, butter top, and cut slits. Sprinkle with granulated sugar.

1 Tbs. unsalted butter, melted plus 3 Tbs. unsalted butter,
cut into small piecesÂ Â â¢Â  3 cloves garlic, mincedÂ Â â¢Â  2 Tbs. finely chopped fresh parsleyÂ Â â¢Â  1Â½ cups shredded GruyÃ¨re cheeseÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ tsp. freshly ground pepperÂ Â â¢Â  2Â½ lb. varietal potatoes, unpeeled and cut into Â¼-inch slicesÂ Â â¢Â  1Â½ cups stock

Preheat oven to 375Â°F. Brush a 2-qt. baking dish with melted butter. In a small bowl stir together garlic, parsley, cheese and pepper. Layer one-third of the potatoes in the prepared dish and sprinkle one - third of the garlic/cheese mixture
over the top. Cover with 1 Tbs. of the butter pieces. Repeat the layers once and finish with the remaining potatoes. Pour the stock and then the remaining garlic-cheese mixture over the layers. Dot with the butter pieces that are left. Cover the dish with a piece of aluminum foil buttered on one side. Bake for 30 min.

Remove the foil and continue baking until the potatoes are tender
and the top is brown and crusty, 30â40 min. longer. Serve immediately. Serves 6. Adapted.

1 Â½ loaf breadÂ Â â¢Â  6 tsp butter, 1 chopped onionÂ Â â¢Â  1 c. chopped celery, 1 tsp sageÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ tsp poultry seasoningÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ tsp. thyme, pepper, salt (tsp)

(for 2-3 persons)

4 onions (middle size)Â Â â¢Â  Â¼ - Â½ teaspoon of oreganoÂ Â â¢Â  2 cloves of garlicÂ Â â¢Â  Â½ bay leafÂ Â â¢Â  2 potatoes (middle size)Â Â â¢Â  Â¼ - Â½ teaspoon of cayenne pepperÂ Â â¢Â  3 ounces of spread or vegetable oilÂ Â â¢Â  3 ounces of tomato pasteÂ Â â¢Â  2 grains of allspiceÂ Â â¢Â  3 ounces of tomato ketchupÂ Â â¢Â  2 juniper berriesÂ Â â¢Â  10 ounces of beefÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ - Â½ teaspoon of marjoramÂ Â â¢Â  saltÂ Â â¢Â  Â¼ - Â½ teaspoon of thymeÂ Â â¢Â  mild curry

Time needed about 1 hour.

1 - Dice the onions and the garlic. Peel the potatoes and dice it. Dice the beef, too.

2 - Heat the spread or the vegetable oil in a large sauce pan, and put the onions, the garlic and the potatoes in it. Spice it with the allspice, the juniper berries, the marjoram, the thyme, the oregano and the bay leaf. Fry all until the onions are transparent. Stir constantly.

3 - Add the cayenne pepper. Brown it a short time, then add the tomato paste, the ketchup and some water. Use so much water that the onion are just covered. Stir well again.

4 - Add the beef. Let the goulash boil about 20 minutes or until the beef is done.

5 - Season the goulash with salt and mild curry.

6 - Enjoy the goulash best with rice or bread and a glass of red wine.
